messages.message:
Hey folks! I have a question: Do y'all know why we use HTTPS for local dev? Figure it would be easier to use plain HTTP. It would also help me with another thing I'm working on, which is to run `server-nginx` on port 80 in crafting sandboxes, and let Crafting do the SSL termination.

Example here (https://ppy-server-nginx--mattfichman-instabase.instabase.site.sandboxes.run/) (this is running on `ppy start aihub` inside my Crafting sandbox, with a local DB).

i think the historical reason is that we used to use the same `server-nginx` config for both local envs and actual envs

i found this old thread (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1617036459159400), which is about fixing the cert used for local envs, but i guess an alternative approach at the time would have been to remove https for local dev - i don’t know why we didn’t consider this :question-block:

also, it seems that the local ssl cert is referenced in the pre-commit script for frontend changes somehow https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XbszN-7RRfv6uSYcdGzLmcEumy1dYu5xM8Nazp1TJBs/edit?disco=AAABWFHtSLU
